Execution Related.Compiler: Translates source code into machine instructions.
Execution Related.Linker: Joins object files into a final executable.
Execution Related.Loader: Loads program into memory before execution.

Memory & Errors.Stack: Stores function calls and local variables.
Memory & Errors.Scope: Region where a variable is accessible.

OOP (Object-Oriented Programming).Destructor: Special method to clean up resources.
OOP (Object-Oriented Programming).Inheritance: Reusing properties and methods from another class.
OOP (Object-Oriented Programming).Encapsulation: Hiding internal data and controlling access.
OOP (Object-Oriented Programming).Abstraction: Showing essential features while hiding details.
OOP (Object-Oriented Programming).Polymorphism: Ability of methods/objects to take many forms.
OOP (Object-Oriented Programming).Overloading: Same method name with different parameters.
OOP (Object-Oriented Programming).Overriding: Subclass provides its own implementation of a method.
OOP (Object-Oriented Programming).Interface: Contract defining methods that a class must implement.
OOP (Object-Oriented Programming).Abstract Class: Class that cannot be instantiated directly.

Data Structures & Algorithms (DSA).Array: Collection of elements stored in contiguous memory locations.
Data Structures & Algorithms (DSA).Linked List: Sequence of nodes where each node points to the next.
Data Structures & Algorithms (DSA).Stack: LIFO (Last In First Out) data structure using push and pop.
Data Structures & Algorithms (DSA).Queue: FIFO (First In First Out) data structure using enqueue and dequeue.
Data Structures & Algorithms (DSA).Deque: Double-ended queue allowing insert/remove from both ends.
Data Structures & Algorithms (DSA).Tree: Hierarchical structure with root and child nodes.
Data Structures & Algorithms (DSA).Binary Tree: Tree where each node has at most two children.
Data Structures & Algorithms (DSA).Binary Search Tree: Binary tree where left < root < right.
Data Structures & Algorithms (DSA).Heap: Complete binary tree used for priority operations.
Data Structures & Algorithms (DSA).Graph: Collection of nodes (vertices) connected by edges.
Data Structures & Algorithms (DSA).Recursion: Function calling itself to solve smaller subproblems.
Data Structures & Algorithms (DSA).Sorting: Arranging elements (Bubble, Selection, Insertion, Merge, Quick, Heap sort).
Data Structures & Algorithms (DSA).Dynamic Programming: Solving problems using overlapping subproblems and memoization.
Data Structures & Algorithms (DSA).Greedy Algorithm: Builds solution step-by-step choosing locally optimal options.
Data Structures & Algorithms (DSA).Divide and Conquer: Break problem into smaller parts and solve recursively.
Data Structures & Algorithms (DSA).Big O Notation: Describes algorithm time and space complexity.
